data.title: Night out
data.text: I've been here many times and the food is always outstanding. Definitely try the pepper jelly, and I would recommend the skirt steak. The extensive bourbon, scotch, and whisky list, along with the many drafts on tap allow for so many different options. The atmosphere is very inviting and I would highly recommend anyone giving it a try if they are in the area.

data.title: My favorite Auburn establishment
data.text: Best fried pickles in America. Nachos are pretty good to. Excellent hamburgers. Fun place to eat. Rich J.

data.title: Great local Place, charming!
data.text: Staff is very friendly from start to finish.  Great menu of southern flare a few with a twist.   Location is in the middle of downtown and convenient walk to all the major area activities.  If there is a wait, it is worth it.

data.title: Best Bison Burger
data.text: Great atmosphere, wonderful service and the best Bison burger ever!  Beer was good too!  Great evening and dinner.

data.title: Brunch crowd management is horrific
data.text: This restaurant does brunch on Sat/Sun only. They open at 9:30am but they let people into the restaurant and seat them before that time. SO if you show up at 9:30, you've missed watching people stand in line starting at 8:30. At 9:30am we put our name on the list for 8 people and were told the wait was appx 45 minutes. An hour and a half later we were told that the previous patrons at "our table" had stayed longer than expected causing the delay. When asked why two 4-tops weren't pushed together it seemed that the only place they would seat a large party was at the picnic table and we were forced to wait for that particular space to open. Once seated and starving we asked the waitress if we could order our food with our drink order and were told "no" that she had to help "pace the kitchen because they were backed up". Eventually the manager came over and told us that our food would take longer than they liked to come out so he was going to send over some complimentary biscuits (4 biscuits for 8 people). Now the biscuits were large, but we had nothing to eat them on! When our food finally arrived I will say that it was good, not really hot, but it was tasty. One person in our party did send back undercooked pancakes - still doughy. Overall, I wouldn't waste 3 1/2 hours on this place again. If they are going to serve brunch efficiently the entire process needs a FULL rework and employees need retraining. They could have made a fortune with a coffee service outside by the number of people waiting around.

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: This place is wait, it has impeccable menu, surrounding itself with high end quality dishes, with regards to a dining experience you and your taste buds will remember and want you coming back for more.

data.title: Outstanding Brunch
data.text: Worth the wait to get in as this was one if the best brunch meals my wife and I have had.  Busy place, so take advantage of the mimosa's while you wait.  Food is plentiful, and very tasty.  Service was exceptional and it was simply a great overall experience.  Extremely busy on game day weekends so plan ahead.  We WILL be back.

data.title: Great night in Auburn, Alabama
data.text: Neighbors from Huntsville, Al. met in Auburn. Crazy to think that we are neighbors, but we seem to be only together in Auburn. This was our first visit to The Hound. The owner also has the Depot restaurant and has the same amazing menu but with a more relaxed and laid back atmosphere. The wait staff is very knowledgable about the wine and special items on the menu. I loved the decor.  We had the bacon wrapped dates... Yummy. I had the veggie lasagna, which was delicious. My husband had the meatloaf and sweet potatoes. Everything was very good and the evening was fun and enjoyable. Matthew, the dining experience was great.

data.title: Another great meal
data.text: Went for drinks and dinner. Wonderful Bourbon selection and they make great martinis. The pork chop was good and the wife had a Brussel Sprout salad that she loved. Great service and fun place.

data.title: Great Brunch
data.text:
The Hound has the absolute BEST brunch in the city of Auburn Hands down!  The food is delicious and the customer service is equally as good.

Ty Evans

data.title: Great dinner, modest prices
data.text: Took the family here after a recent VCOMM function. Food was good, I had the pork chop, the BBQ sauce on the onions was great! A bit loud in our back room, not for a quiet intimate meal. But prices were very reasonable for the atmosphere and food!

data.title: Great food in the Loveliest Village on the Plain
data.text:
We ate at the Hound for the first time last weekend.  Their menu had a wide-range of food options to suit my husband and me as well as our vegetarian daughter and niece.  We started with pimiento cheese dip which was very good and then had a variety of meals including vegetarian lasagne, veggie burger, bison burger, and steak.

All of the meals were delicious and they offer lots of topping choices for the burgers.  They also have a good selection of wine and beer.

Our server was very friendly and attentive and we really liked the ambience as well with brick interior walls and a warm, inviting decor.

We will definitely dine here again!

data.title: Great Food and atmosphere
data.text: Had lunch with a friend here while I was evacuating from Charleston due to Hurricane Matthew.  The food was delicious and it was great to watch college football while there.

data.title: My favorite "New" Auburn spot
data.text:
I love the hound and this review is going to be based off of several visits there.  This is a great place for atmosphere.  There is usually a wait, but the bar can help you pass the time with plenty of beer and cocktail selections. 

We have had several appetizers.  The fried green beans, pepper jelly and pimento cheese are excellent.  The bacon wrapped dates are also delicious, but they are $9 for only 4 of them while the other appetizers I mentioned are the same price with far more food for sharing.  That is literally my only complaint about this place.

The burgers are delicious and the meatloaf is my most frequent choice.  You can't go wrong with a visit to The Hound.  I do recommend going early though because they are always busy, especially on football weekends.

data.title: Good food, nice college ambience
data.text: Ate here with the family on an SEC college tour for my youngest daughter. Close to Auburn University, clearly caters to students but quite a few families there as well since it was summer. Short wait, but reservations recommended during the school year. Very good food, great service, interesting décor. Would certainly go back.

data.title: A Great Place to eat and relax.
data.text:
This  pub style restaurant is a great place to go out for food and drinks right in the heart of down town auburn.
The food is excellent, try the meatloaf and their pepper jelly.

data.title: Delicious food with awesome service!
data.text: We were warmly greeted and promptly seated upon entering. We told the waitress it was our first time there, so she took the opportunity to tell us about the history, explained the décor, and went into great detail about the menu (fairly small, but has anything you might want) after bringing our drinks. She recommended the pimento cheese and saltine crackers. I am very picky about the pimento cheese I call good, but theirs fit the bill nicely. I ordered the bison burger with fried onions and mushrooms and fries. It was perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. My husband ordered the special, which was some sort of Philly cheese-type of dish on a fried dumpling. The bite I had was succulent. Our waitress was very kind, kept our drinks full, and was quick to anticipate our needs of extra napkins and ketchup. We will definitely be returning the next time we're in Auburn at lunchtime.

data.title: Unusual, but fantastic Southern menu
data.text: Even though it was a busy home game weekend, once we were seated the service was prompt and welcoming.  There is an adjoining coffee house that offers specialty coffees to the Hound patrons.  I'd encourage you to try the bourbon caramel latte.  My wife had the granola french toast, I had the southern benedict.  Highly recommend either one.  Polished tables, but definite honky tonk, Southern style.

data.title: Great Southern Menu
data.text: I have ate at The Hound a few times. I have found there is no wrong choice on their southern inspired menu. The last time I went I got a delicious pork chop, which was one of the juiciest chops I have ever ate. The Hound is located in an old brick building and is decorated with a lot of dark art. This restarting has a wonderful atmosphere with very attentive staff. Their bar is also impressive with a good selection  of craft beer and a great selection of bourbon .

data.title: Manly lunch
data.text: The dark and outdoorsy atmosphere of this restaurant reflect the menu perfectly. Fresh cut fries alongside a fried chicken sandwich paired with a cold draft beer are my choice nearly every lunch there.
